narrative.title: Catanzaro Division - 1940Q3
narrative.situation: Italian infantry_autotrasportabile deployed in North Africa during 1940Q3.
narrative.objectives: Infantry division for defensive positions guarding Tobruk approaches. Autotrasportabile classification meant truck-transportable but division lacked adequate vehicles. Green division unsuited for offensive operations.
narrative.axis_objective: Maintain defensive positions and inflict maximum casualties on Allied forces.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and secure strategic objectives while minimizing casualties.

weather.terrain: Coastal plain with rocky desert inland

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: Standard Italian infantry division structure (two regiments)
Full complement of support weapons (when operational)
Larger personnel strength than colonial/CCNN divisions (10,500 men)

environment.terrain_type: Coastal plain with rocky desert inland
